business.headline: Cabinet approves Rs 30,000 crore subsidy to oil companies to keep LPG prices stableThe decision aims to protect consumers from changes in global LPG prices and support the financial health of the public sector oil companies.

Sensex cracks below 80,000 as tariff fears rattle stock marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 765.47 points to close below the psychological 80,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 232.85 points to settle at 24,363.30. Midcap and smallcap stocks witnessed deeper cuts, reflecting growing investor unease over the evolving global trade scenario.

India not a dead economy, poised to become 3rd-largest in world: Amitabh KantAfter Donald Trump's 'dead economy' jibe, Amitabh Kant calls India a resilient, reform-driven powerhouse on track to become the world's third-largest economy.

US tariff surge could stall India's manufacturing momentum, warns Moody'sOn Thursday, US President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order that adds a 25% tariff on Indian goods. This move comes in response to India's continued import of oil from Russia.

How much will India's fuel bill rise if it stops buying oil from Russia?Russia currently provides 10% of the world's crude supply. If multiple countries stop buying from Russia at once, crude oil prices could rise by around 10%, as per the report. That would affect everyone, not just India.
Gold hits record high of Rs 1.02 lakh. Is it the right time to buy?The rally in gold comes amid growing concerns over new tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump.

Arvind Panagariya bets on these states to leads India's growth by 2047Arvind Panagariya explained that India doesn't need to push growth artificially. He believes market forces are already at work, shaping the country's growth naturally.

Nitin Gadkari dismisses concerns over ethanol-blended petrol as misinformationUnion Minister Nitin Gadkari firmly defended the government's ethanol-blended petrol initiative, stating that no complaints have surfaced about vehicle issues. Speaking at the India@100 Summit, he challenged critics to cite a single case of malfunction and accused them of spreading baseless misinformation.

Nitin Gadkari's dare on E20 petrol row: Show a single instance of cars facing issueSpeaking at a session during the Business Today India@100 Summit, Nitin Gadkari said no complaints had been reported so far and accused detractors of spreading misinformation about the government's ethanol-blending programme.

NSDL shares are on a dream run after listing. Should you buy now?The NSDL stock, which made its market debut on August 6, has now risen for three straight sessions—prompting IPO investors to ask: is it time to book profits or hold on?

Want to save tax by claiming HRA for rent paid to parents? Read this firstAccording to tax rules, salaried individuals can claim HRA even if they're living in their parents' home. But the rent must be real, paid regularly, and documented properly.

Government may approve Rs 30,000 crore support to maintain LPG price stabilityThis move is aimed at helping oil marketing companies recover losses they have been facing on domestic LPG sales due to high international prices.

entertainment.headline: Coolie advance booking soars in Kerala, Rajinikanth's film set for massive openingSuperstar Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' eyes the biggest international opening for a Tamil film. The film's advance bookings in Kerala show a promising momentum at the box office.

Jimmy Fallon trolls Trump's India tariffs, jokes about Putin and Sydney SweeneyJimmy Fallon roasted President Trump's tariff plans affecting over 90 countries, including India and Brazil. The American comedian, in his monologue, highlighted the economic impacts surrounding Trump's trade policies.

Is Sydney Sweeney part of The Devil Wears Prada 2? Fans think soHollywood actor Sydney Sweeney sparks casting rumours after being captured on 'The Devil Wears Prada 2' set, amid backlash over her American Eagle ad campaign.

Chhoriyan Chali Gaon: Anita promises to support village children after show wrapsActor Anita Hassanandani said she will continue to support the children she's staying with in MP's Bamuliya village. Her support came on the reality TV show 'Chhoriyan Chali Gaon' on Zee TV.

Singer Ed Sheeran turns bride for Harry Potter star Rupert Grint. WatchPop star Ed Sheeran turned into a bride for Harry Potter star Rupert Grint, known for playing the role of Ronald Weasley in the popular fantasy franchise. He was previously featured as Ed Sheeran's stalker in the 2011 music video 'Lego House'.

Karan Aujla, Honey Singh summoned by Punjab Women's Commission over vulgar lyricsKaran Aujla and Honey Singh's recent songs face criticism for alleged offensive language, prompting action by the Punjab State Women's Commission.

How K-drama's female actors are rewriting revenge storiesFrom 'The Glory' to 'My Name', K-drama female leads are ditching the damsel-in-distress trope for fierce, calculated revenge. In this week's K-fix we'll discuss how they're redefining power on-screen.

Kammatam: Malayalam crime thriller, based on true events, to stream on Zee5Zee5 is set to release 'Kammatam', a six-episode Malayalam crime thriller series based on a controversial Thrissur case.  The show stars Sudev Nair and unravels a gripping investigation filled with secrets and suspense.

Andhera trailer: Surveen Chawla, Prakajta and Karanvir Malhotra face sinister evilThe trailer of 'Andhera' featuring Surveen Chawla, Prajakta Koli, and Karanvir Malhotra is out. The eight-episode series will premiere on Prime Video on August 14.

Honey Singh releases One Thousand Miles music video 11 years after its launchRapper-singer Honey Singh finally released the video for his song 'One Thousand Miles' on Friday. The audio, which was a part of Singh's 'Desi Kalaakar' album, was released in 2014.

Jatadhara teaser: Sudheer Babu's selflessness clashes with Sonakshi Sinha's greedThe teaser of Sonakshi Sinha and Sudheer Babu's 'Jatadhara' released today. The mythical supernatural thriller is directed by Venkat Kalyan and Abhishek Jaiswal.

How Chhoriyan Chali Gaon is changing the way we look at Indian reality TV'Chhoriyan Chali Gaon', a new show on Zee TV, is bringing a refreshing twist to Indian reality TV. It features 11 celebrities from city life adapting to a rural village in Madhya Pradesh. Some of the contestants include actor Anita Hassanandani, comedian Sumukhi Suresh and influencer duo Chinki-Minki.

Kapil Sharma shoots with Janhvi Kapoor-Sidharth Malhotra amid Bishnoi gang threatsIt was business as usual for comedian Kapil Sharma as he began shooting with Janhvi Kapoor and Sidharth Malhotra for his show a day after gunshots were fired at his restaurant in Canada by the members of the Bishnoi gang.

Isha Talwar criticises casting director Shanoo Sharma's weird audition demandActor Isha Talwar shared a decade-old experience where casting director Shanoo Sharma asked her to perform a crying scene in a busy restaurant, which deeply affected her confidence. She advises newcomers to stand firm against unreasonable demands during auditions and emphasises the need for respectful casting environments.

Janhvi-Sidharth's steamy chemistry wins over rain in Bheegi Saree. WatchSidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor star in the newly released monsoon song 'Bheegi Saree', marking a return for Adnan Sami alongside Shreya Ghoshal's vocals in 'Param Sundari'.

Rajinikanth's Coolie to get 50-year tribute video, new runtime revealedSuperstar Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' will hit theatres on August 14. While the film was certified with an A certificate, the team decided to make a few additions to the film.

Salman Khan introduces family as faces of Fantastic Four collectionActor Salman Khan's clothing label has partnered with Marvel India to launch an exciting new collection inspired by the 'Fantastic Four' film. The actor shared a post online with his family members.

Nishaanchi teaser: Anurag Kashyap introduces Aaishvary in desi action entertainerThe teaser for 'Nishaanchi', starring debutant Aaishvary Thackeray, was released on Friday, promising action and drama. Directed by Anurag Kashyap, the action-drama is slated for a theatrical release on September 19.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi Ep 10: Big drama unfolds before Pari's engagementAt Shanti Niketan, the air is thick with excitement as Pari's engagement preparations begin. But while the family bonds over bhajiyas and dance, a deleted sketch and a secret threaten to change everything.

general news.headline: Won't forgive Rahul Gandhi for echoing Trump's 'dead economy' jibe: Piyush GoyalExclusive: India will never forgive Rahul Gandhi for parroting Trump's 'dead economy' jibe, says Piyush Goyal

No decision to scrap India-US defence deals after Trump tariffs: SourcesDays after US President Donald Trump doubled India's tariffs to 50 per cent, sources told India Today TV that no decision has been taken to cancel defence deals with Washington, DC, and that the status quo on defence procurement has been maintained.

US picked wrong target: Tharoor calls Trump 'school bully' over 'dead economy' jibeSpeaking to India Today's Consulting Editor Rajdeep Sardesai about Donald Trump's "dead economy" jab, Shashi Tharoor said that India's self-respect was sacrosanct and "simply not up for bargaining".

China welcomes PM's SCO Summit visit, calls it gathering of solidarity, friendshipChinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Guo Jiakun said the SCO summit, to be held from August 31 to September 1, will see participation from leaders of over 20 countries, including all member states.

Frozen bodies holding guns: When 120 bahadur took on 5,000 Chinese soldiersJust 120 Indian soldiers, led by Major Shaitan Singh Bhati, beat back 5,000 Chinese troopers at Rezang La in 1962, preventing China's takeover of Ladakh. A search party found frozen bodies of Indian soldiers still holding guns, showing the last stand in which 110 of the 120 Indians were killed. Revisiting the legendary battle of the 1962 Indo-China war, which is the subject of Farhan Akhtar's 120 Bahadur.

Voter Fraud is Real, Let's Talk SolutionsIn his presentation titled 'Vote Chori', Rahul Gandhi claimed that in a state his party won, unaccounted voters stole the elections by voting or not voting. While the voter list seems to be a problem, even the SIR to fix it has sparked controversy. What's the solution then?

India-Russia bear hug is another Trump self-goalThough India and Russia had strong ties, New Delhi was trying to balance that as relations with the US were on the upswing. However, Donald Trump's tariff bazooka might see India's Russia hug get tighter. Russian President Putin is set to visit New Delhi later this year. Trump has, ironically, driven India towards Russia like the US did with its arms embargo in the mid-60s.

MP High Court says 'ideal Indian wife' tolerates decades of desertion by husbandThe court said that this was a unique case depicting the loyalty of the wife as a typical Indian woman, who puts all her efforts into saving her family life.

Dangerous to reduce age of consent for sex below 18: Centre in Supreme CourtThe Centre defended the age of consent at 18 as essential to protecting minors, warning that lowering it would weaken child protection and enable abuse. It opposed exceptions, saying girls risk being exploited under the guise of consent. This came after senior advocate Indira Jaising urged the SC to reduce the age to 16, citing the criminalisation of adolescent relationships.

Why additional Trump tariffs will be a big pain point for IndiaThe extra 25 per cent 'ad valorem' duty on Indian imports—seen as a new negotiating tactic by the Trump administration—will have a sizeable impact on India's growth in the short term

Income Tax Bill 2025, introduced in February, withdrawn; new version on August 11A new version of the Income Tax Bill, incorporating most of the recommendations made by the Select Committee chaired by Baijayant Panda, will be introduced on Monday.

Cabinet approves Rs 30,000 crore subsidy to oil companies to keep LPG prices stableThe decision aims to protect consumers from changes in global LPG prices and support the financial health of the public sector oil companies.

What India-US trade tensions mean for Indian students' education plans abroadIf the diplomatic relationship continues to sour, future work visa opportunities like the H-1B or post-study Optional Practical Training programmes could face tighter caps or restrictions.

17 dead, 33 missing in China flash floods, landslide, Xi orders all-out rescue opsRelentless rains have triggered deadly flash floods in China's Gansu province, killing at least 10. The disaster comes as the country battles some of its worst August downpours in decades.

Nitin Gadkari's dare on E20 petrol row: Show a single instance of cars facing issueSpeaking at a session during the Business Today India@100 Summit, Nitin Gadkari said no complaints had been reported so far and accused detractors of spreading misinformation about the government's ethanol-blending programme.

Kerala man stalks colleague in UK despite arrests, faces deportationA 26-year-old Kerala man is facing deportation from the UK after repeatedly stalking his female colleague at London Zoo, despite multiple arrests and bail conditions. Asish Jose Paul allegedly harassed the woman with messages, gifts, and showed up to her workplace uninvited. He has now been given a six-month sentence, suspended for one year.

Sholay@50: The Making of Gabbar, Bollywood's Greatest VillainWhat made Gabbar Singh the greatest villain in Bollywood history? It wasn't just Amjad's performance, though his raw intensity was undeniable. It was the magic of Salim-Javed's writing, Sippy's vision, and Amjad's ability to transcend the archetype of the Bollywood villain.

80 voters in 10 sq ft house: India Today ground check on Rahul Gandhi's claimAfter Rahul Gandhi's explosive vote fraud claims, India Today's ground check in Bengaluru Central found 80 voters registered at a 10-15 sq ft house in Muni Reddy Garden. The current occupant denied links to them. The property's owner admitted many former tenants still return to vote.

Couple claims Delhi restaurant refused entry over Indian attire. Video goes viralIn a now-viral video shared on social media, the woman was seen dressed in a churidaar-kurta set while her partner wore a T-shirt and pants as both claimed they were stopped at the entrance due to their attire.

Paneer and ghee most adulterated foods: Is homemade the safer option?Punjab's paneer samples fail large-scale quality tests, raising health concerns. Authorities urge consumers to prefer homemade or certified dairy to avoid adulterants and misleading products.

Woman films reel on roof of moving Thar in Gurugram, case registeredThe incident, which took place on Gurugram's National Highway-48, has sparked widespread outrage, highlighting the growing trend of traffic violations in the name of online fame.

Coolie advance booking soars in Kerala, Rajinikanth's film set for massive openingSuperstar Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' eyes the biggest international opening for a Tamil film. The film's advance bookings in Kerala show a promising momentum at the box office.

Dining solo might be the best thing you do this weekNext time you feel awkward about going on a solo date, know that eating alone can be really refreshing. It helps you slow down, enjoy your food, and connect with yourself.

Jennifer Lopez shops at rival brands after being denied entry at Chanel storeActor Jennifer Lopez was refused entry to a Chanel store in Istanbul due to full capacity. She later shopped at rival luxury brands, highlighting a rare celebrity shopping snub.

sports.headline: Who is Haider Ali? Once Pakistan's U19 World Cup star amid criminal investigationYoung Pakistan batter Haider Ali has been suspended by the Pakistan Cricket Board after he was arrested last month in Manchester during the Pakistan Shaheens' tour of England.

IPL 2026: R Ashwin in talks with CSK over future, may join new franchiseFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, who was signed by the Chennai Super Kings in the mega auction ahead of the 2025 Indian Premier League (IPL) season, is currently in discussions with the five-time champions regarding his future with the franchise.

Virat Kohli begins training for ODI comeback in London, IPL coach joins himVirat Kohli has begun practising for his return to ODI cricket in London. The former captain is set to play for India in a three-match ODI series in Australia from October 19 to 25.

Croatia's Zach Vukusic becomes historic youngest-ever international captainZak Vukusic made history on Thursday after becoming the youngest captain in international cricket. He broke the record of France's Noman Amjad, who held the record earlier at 18 years and 24 days.

Slot excited for Crystal Palace challenge, confirms Nunez's exit talksArne Slot remains excited for Liverpool's clash against Crystal Palace for the FA Community Shield. The Premier League-winning coach knows that a tricky opposition awaits them at Wembley. He also talked about Darwin Nunez and his rumoured exit.

Gill silences doubters, Jadeja stands tall: Parthiv Patel on England tourENG vs IND: Parthiv Patel was all praise for both Shubman Gill and Ravindra Jadeja for their performances in the England Test series, implying that the two had a key role in their success.

Karun Nair looked shaken: Irfan Pathan rates India batter 4/10 for England seriesFormer India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has criticised Karun Nair for failing to make the most of his Test comeback, pointing to the batter's inconsistent scores and squandered opportunities during the Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy series.

Harry Kane praises special Heung-min Son following ex-team-mate's Spurs exitBayern Munich striker Harry Kane paid tribute to his former team-mate Heung-min Son following his departure from Tottenham Hotspur. Son joined Los Angeles FC on Wednesday in a record-breaking Major League Soccer transfer.

ICC pitch ratings for England vs India revealed: Only Leeds gets good ratingThree pitches used in the Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy failed to get the highest ICC rating. The Leeds pitch at Headingley stood out as the only one rated very good. India and England shared the trophy after a drawn series.

Bob Carter steps down as New Zealand Cricket high-performance coach after 21 yearsFormer New Zealand Women's head coach Bob Carter is stepping away from his role as New Zealand Cricket's (NZC) high-performance coach after 21 years.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
